qas.question: Where was Equatorial African ran from?
What plant was mandated to be grown by the French?
What important infrastructure was built in the 1920s.
What religion was spread through CAR?
What country was established during the 1920's and 1930's?
Where was the Congo-Ocean Railway run from?
What were Christians forced to work on?
How many workers established Protestant missions?

plausible_answers.text: exhaustion, illness, or the poor conditions

qas.question: What conditions did the Ubangi-Shari suffer from?

context: In <a0_0>1920<a0_0/> <b5_0>French Equatorial Africa<b5_0/> was established and Ubangi-Shari was administered from <a1_0><b6_0>Brazzaville<b6_0/><a1_0/>. During the 1920s and 1930s the French introduced a policy of mandatory <a2_0>cotton<a2_0/> cultivation, <a3_0>a network of roads<a3_0/> was built, attempts were made to combat sleeping sickness and Protestant missions were established to spread <a4_0>Christianity<a4_0/>. New forms of forced labor were also introduced and a large number of Ubangians were sent to work on <b7_0>the Congo-Ocean Railway<b7_0/>. Many of these forced laborers died of <b9_0>exhaustion, illness, or the poor conditions<b9_0/> which claimed between 20% and 25% of the <b8_0>127,000 workers<b8_0/>.
